Material used.Description: Transgenic Drosophila over-expressing various human LRRK2 alleles, including wild type, G2019S, Y1699C, and G2385R LRRK2.

Readout description.Result Description: Late-onset loss of dopaminergic (DA) neurons in selected clusters that is accompanied by locomotion deficits.
Late-onset loss of dopaminergic (DA) neurons in selected clusters that is accompanied by locomotion deficits.
Late-onset loss of dopaminergic (DA) neurons in selected clusters that is accompanied by locomotion deficits.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No loss of DA neurons in any of the clusters.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant degeneration of DA neurons in the PPM clusters 1 and 3.

Material used.Description: Transgenic Drosophila over-expressing various human LRRK2 alleles, including wild type, G2019S, Y1699C, and G2385R LRRK2.

Readout description.Result Description: Dramatically poorer climbing scores (Ͻ10% success) compared with control flies.
Dramatically poorer climbing scores (Ͻ10% success) compared with control flies.
Climbing ability is not significantly compromised.

Biological replicates.Description: Three groups of 20 female adult flies were tested.

Technical replicates.Description: Three trials were performed in each experiment at 15 min intervals.

Basic positive control.Description: Age-matched normal flies were used as controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Climbing ability similar to control flies.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Climbing scores (Ͻ10% success) compared with control flies.
